title: Battle In Bulgar
opening: After defeating the Djute tribe, Roy moved toward Bulgar, the largest city in
As a center of commerce between Etruria, Bern, and Ilia, Bulgar has had a
history of being free city without a ruler.  However, with Bern's invasion,
Advisor Roartz now had control of the city under Bern's protection.
Roy approached Bulgar to liberate it and to gain some useful information on

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: They’re here...! And so quickly... Could they not have given me the time to at least set up a defense!?

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: We will try to stop the enemy from progressing any further. You can retreat to the palace and fortify your defenses there.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: ...Can you hold them back?

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: We must at least try.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: If you do not know whether you can win or not...

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: Then what would you do? Flee? Tell me, just where do you think you can hide?

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: General Brunnya has given me orders to protect you. I will do so with my life. But you must not be afraid to fight, either!

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: ... A-All right... Then I shall fortify the inside and leave the outside to you.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: ...That is the highest advisor of the Etrurian court? Why should we fight for a coward like him?

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: Don’t say that. General Brunnya didn’t willingly tell us to protect him. She had no choice because Etruria joined forces with Bern. ...Therefore, we must fulfill our duties as warriors.

intro.speaker: Kel
intro.line: I have also gotten hold of information that the allies of the Silver Wolf are lurking around here. Keep your guard.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, sir.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess Guinevere.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...We fight again today.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes... I am sorry that I cannot find the time to talk with you at leisure.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: Please, do not worry. ...My brother started this in the first place.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess...

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...Yes?

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: May I ask the reason why Bern’s former king tried to murder King Zephiel?

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...Zephiel and I were born from different mothers. I am actually only his half-sister.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I heard that Zephiel’s mother was the queen of Etruria.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: Yes. It was an arranged marriage to strengthen the tie between Bern and Etruria. However, our father already had a woman he loved at that time. That was my mother.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: The marriage between our father and Zephiel’s mother was forced. Therefore, our father didn’t love Zephiel’s mother, and always thought badly of Zephiel.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Then is that why the former king and King Zephiel had a bad relationship?

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: No... Even then, Zephiel was always trying his best to gain our father’s affection. He excelled in his studies and military training, and he was always trying hard. He grew to become a proud heir to Bern’s throne.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Then why did the king try to...

intro.speaker: Soldier From Off-Screen
intro.line: Master Roy! We are ready for the attack!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right, I’ll be there in a minute! Princess Guinevere, I’m sorry, but...

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: No, it is all right. Please be careful.

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: Well, well... So it has begun.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Just when we thought Bern had finished invading, now we have to deal with Etruria. Sigh...

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: Small wonder. This is a large trading city. Any army would want control of it. Well, then...

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: H-Hey, wait, where are you going?

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: I’m going to watch the fight. Let’s see how worthy that Roy is.

battle.speaker: Niime
battle.line: Don’t you worry about me. Everything will be fine.

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: What? Hey, wait! You’re leaving, too?

battle.speaker: Kel
battle.line: The reinforcements should be arriving soon... I want you to open the front gate to let the reinforcements in when they arrive.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: All right, they should be here soon... Open the gate!

battle.speaker: Kel
battle.line: Tell the troops to start attacking the guerilla forces hiding in the houses.

boss.speaker: Kel
boss.line: I am Kel. Behold my blade…as I swing it for the last time.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Hm. You’re not too bad, are you?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Wh-Who are you!?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: What the!? Hey! I said you couldn’t come in. Master Roy is very busy.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What’s the matter?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Well, Master Roy, she kept pestering me that she wanted to see you. But you were busy, so I was trying to drive her away.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Listen to me first. Then you can decide whether you want to get rid of me or not. I think I have information that you might be interested in.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...What is that?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: It’s about the humans who change form into beasts.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...I want to speak with her in private. Can you leave the room?

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Yes, sir.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Well, well, that got you interested, didn’t it?

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Those beasts you speak of...

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Right. Dragons.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dragons... They are not the wyverns that Bern’s Dragon Knights ride, but the strange troops that are mixed in with Bern’s soldiers...

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Exactly. Those are the Dragons that were supposedly defeated in the Scouring.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...Who are you?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: I am Niime, a scholar of ancient Dark Magic. Some call me the Hermit on the Mountain. This war...at first, I thought it was just another skirmish, so I didn’t pay heed of it. But now...I can feel evil among Bern’s troops, so I’m investigating.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Were you able to find out anything?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: The Dragons are indeed shrouded in mystery. I looked through many ancient books and scrolls, but I could only decipher so many of them. But...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...But?

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: I have come to believe that Bern has resurrected the Dark Dragon.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Dark Dragon... That is the leader of the Dragons that Hartmut defeated.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Right. Dragons are a much more advanced species then us humans. They have much greater vitality and intellect than us. However, there was one thing that the Dragons lagged far behind the humans in. The Dragons’ reproductive system was much less efficient than that of the humans. But even then, the Dark Dragon...it had the power to create more Dragons. That is what I learned from my research.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: It can make more Dragons...

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: The Dark Dragon can create more of its kind. That would explain where Bern has been getting all of its Dragons.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: That is possible.

end.speaker: Niime
end.line: Now, that being said... I want to learn more about the Dragons. Let me accompany your travels. I wield Dark Magic...I’m sure I can be of some assistance.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Of course. We want to learn about the Dragons as well. It may be dangerous, but it that’s okay with you, you’re welcome to join us.
